00002 //*****************************************************************************
00003 //
00004 // File Name    : 'lcd.c'
00005 // Title                : Character LCD driver for HD44780/SED1278 displays
00006 //                                      (usable in mem-mapped, or I/O mode)
00007 // Author               : Pascal Stang
00008 // Created              : 11/22/2000
00009 // Revised              : 4/30/2002
00010 // Version              : 1.1
00011 // Target MCU   : Atmel AVR series
00012 // Editor Tabs  : 4

00015 //              which can be found at http://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl.txt

00027 
00028 void write_data(unsigned char data) {
00029         unsigned char temp=0;
00030         
00031         if (data & (1<<0))
00032                 temp |= (1<<7);
00033         if (data & (1<<1))
00034                 temp |= (1<<6);
00035         if (data & (1<<2))
00036                 temp |= (1<<5);
00037         if (data & (1<<3))
00038                 temp |= (1<<4);
00039         if (data & (1<<4))
00040                 temp |= (1<<3);
00041         if (data & (1<<5))
00042                 temp |= (1<<2);
00043         if (data & (1<<6))
00044                 temp |= (1<<1);
00045         if (data & (1<<7))
00046                 temp |= (1<<0);
00047         
00048         outb(LCD_DATA_POUT,temp);
00049 }
00050 
00051 unsigned char read_data(void) {
00052         unsigned char data = inb(LCD_DATA_PIN);
00053         unsigned char temp=0;
00054         
00055         if (data & (1<<0))
00056                 temp |= (1<<7);
00057         if (data & (1<<1))
00058                 temp |= (1<<6);
00059         if (data & (1<<2))
00060                 temp |= (1<<5);
00061         if (data & (1<<3))
00062                 temp |= (1<<4);
00063         if (data & (1<<4))
00064                 temp |= (1<<3);
00065         if (data & (1<<5))
00066                 temp |= (1<<2);
00067         if (data & (1<<6))
00068                 temp |= (1<<1);
00069         if (data & (1<<7))
00070                 temp |= (1<<0);
00071         
00072         return(temp);
00073 }

00076 // custom LCD characters
00077 unsigned char __attribute__ ((progmem)) LcdCustomChar[] =
00078 {
00079         0x00, 0x1F, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x1F, 0x00, // 0. 0/5 full progress block
00080         0x00, 0x1F, 0x10, 0x10, 0x10, 0x10, 0x1F, 0x00, // 1. 1/5 full progress block
00081         0x00, 0x1F, 0x18, 0x18, 0x18, 0x18, 0x1F, 0x00, // 2. 2/5 full progress block
00082         0x00, 0x1F, 0x1C, 0x1C, 0x1C, 0x1C, 0x1F, 0x00, // 3. 3/5 full progress block
00083         0x00, 0x1F, 0x1E, 0x1E, 0x1E, 0x1E, 0x1F, 0x00, // 4. 4/5 full progress block
00084         0x00, 0x1F, 0x1F, 0x1F, 0x1F, 0x1F, 0x1F, 0x00, // 5. 5/5 full progress block
00085         0x03, 0x07, 0x0F, 0x1F, 0x0F, 0x07, 0x03, 0x00, // 6. rewind arrow
00086         0x00, 0x1F, 0x1F, 0x1F, 0x1F, 0x1F, 0x1F, 0x00, // 7. stop block
00087         0x1B, 0x1B, 0x1B, 0x1B, 0x1B, 0x1B, 0x1B, 0x00, // 8. pause bars
00088         0x18, 0x1C, 0x1E, 0x1F, 0x1E, 0x1C, 0x18, 0x00, // 9. fast-forward arrow
00089         0x00, 0x04, 0x04, 0x0E, 0x0E, 0x1F, 0x1F, 0x00, // 10. scroll up arrow
00090         0x00, 0x1F, 0x1F, 0x0E, 0x0E, 0x04, 0x04, 0x00, // 11. scroll down arrow
00091         0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, // 12. blank character
00092         0x00, 0x0E, 0x19, 0x15, 0x13, 0x0E, 0x00, 0x00, // 13. animated play icon frame 0
00093         0x00, 0x0E, 0x15, 0x15, 0x15, 0x0E, 0x00, 0x00, // 14. animated play icon frame 1
00094         0x00, 0x0E, 0x13, 0x15, 0x19, 0x0E, 0x00, 0x00, // 15. animated play icon frame 2
00095         0x00, 0x0E, 0x11, 0x1F, 0x11, 0x0E, 0x00, 0x00, // 16. animated play icon frame 3
00096 };

00101 
00102 void lcdInitHW(void)
00103 {
00104         // initialize I/O ports
00105         // if I/O interface is in use
00106 #ifdef LCD_PORT_INTERFACE
00107         // initialize LCD control lines
00108         cbi(LCD_CTRL_PORT, LCD_CTRL_RS);
00109         cbi(LCD_CTRL_PORT, LCD_CTRL_RW);
00110         cbi(LCD_CTRL_PORT, LCD_CTRL_E);
00111         // initialize LCD control lines to output
00112         sbi(LCD_CTRL_DDR, LCD_CTRL_RS);
00113         sbi(LCD_CTRL_DDR, LCD_CTRL_RW);
00114         sbi(LCD_CTRL_DDR, LCD_CTRL_E);
00115         // initialize LCD data port to input
00116         // initialize LCD data lines to pull-up
00117         #ifdef LCD_DATA_4BIT
00118                 outb(LCD_DATA_DDR, inb(LCD_DATA_DDR)&0x0F);             // set data I/O lines to input (4bit)
00119                 write_data(read_data() |0xF0);  // set pull-ups to on (4bit)
00120         #else
00121                 outb(LCD_DATA_DDR, 0x00);                                               // set data I/O lines to input (8bit)
00122                 write_data(0xFF);                                               // set pull-ups to on (8bit)
00123         #endif
00124 #else
00125         // enable external memory bus if not already enabled
00126         sbi(MCUCR, SRE);                        // enable bus interface
00127 #endif
00128 }
00129 
00130 void lcdBusyWait(void)
00131 {
00132         // wait until LCD busy bit goes to zero
00133         // do a read from control register
00134 #ifdef LCD_PORT_INTERFACE
00135         cbi(LCD_CTRL_PORT, LCD_CTRL_RS);                                // set RS to "control"
00136         #ifdef LCD_DATA_4BIT
00137                 outb(LCD_DATA_DDR, inb(LCD_DATA_DDR)&0x0F);     // set data I/O lines to input (4bit)
00138                 write_data(read_data() |0xF0);  // set pull-ups to on (4bit)
00139         #else
00140                 outb(LCD_DATA_DDR, 0x00);                                       // set data I/O lines to input (8bit)
00141                 write_data(0xFF);                                       // set pull-ups to on (8bit)
00142         #endif
00143         sbi(LCD_CTRL_PORT, LCD_CTRL_RW);                                // set R/W to "read"
00144         sbi(LCD_CTRL_PORT, LCD_CTRL_E);                                 // set "E" line
00145         LCD_DELAY;                                                              // wait
00146         while(read_data() & 1<<LCD_BUSY)
00147         {
00148                 cbi(LCD_CTRL_PORT, LCD_CTRL_E);         // clear "E" line
00149                 LCD_DELAY;                                                                      // wait
00150                 LCD_DELAY;                                                                      // wait
00151                 sbi(LCD_CTRL_PORT, LCD_CTRL_E);         // set "E" line
00152                 LCD_DELAY;                                                                      // wait
00153                 LCD_DELAY;                                                                      // wait
00154                 #ifdef LCD_DATA_4BIT                                            // do an extra clock for 4 bit reads
00155                         cbi(LCD_CTRL_PORT, LCD_CTRL_E); // clear "E" line
00156                         LCD_DELAY;                                                              // wait
00157                         LCD_DELAY;                                                              // wait
00158                         sbi(LCD_CTRL_PORT, LCD_CTRL_E); // set "E" line
00159                         LCD_DELAY;                                                              // wait
00160                         LCD_DELAY;                                                              // wait
00161                 #endif
00162         }
00163         cbi(LCD_CTRL_PORT, LCD_CTRL_E);                 // clear "E" line
00164         //      leave data lines in input mode so they can be most easily used for other purposes
00165 #else
00166         // memory bus read
00167         // sbi(MCUCR, SRW);                     // enable RAM waitstate
00168         // wait until LCD busy bit goes to zero
00169         while( (*((volatile unsigned char *) (LCD_CTRL_ADDR))) & (1<<LCD_BUSY) );
00170         // cbi(MCUCR, SRW);                     // disable RAM waitstate
00171 #endif
00172 }
00173 
00174 void lcdControlWrite(u08 data) 
00175 {
00176 // write the control byte to the display controller
00177 #ifdef LCD_PORT_INTERFACE
00178         lcdBusyWait();                                                  // wait until LCD not busy
00179         cbi(LCD_CTRL_PORT, LCD_CTRL_RS);                        // set RS to "control"
00180         cbi(LCD_CTRL_PORT, LCD_CTRL_RW);                        // set R/W to "write"
00181         #ifdef LCD_DATA_4BIT
00182                 // 4 bit write
00183                 sbi(LCD_CTRL_PORT, LCD_CTRL_E); // set "E" line
00184                 outb(LCD_DATA_DDR, inb(LCD_DATA_DDR)|0xF0);     // set data I/O lines to output (4bit)
00185                 write_data((read_data() &0x0F) | (data&0xF0) ); // output data, high 4 bits
00186                 LCD_DELAY;                                                              // wait
00187                 LCD_DELAY;                                                              // wait
00188                 cbi(LCD_CTRL_PORT, LCD_CTRL_E); // clear "E" line
00189                 LCD_DELAY;                                                              // wait
00190                 LCD_DELAY;                                                              // wait
00191                 sbi(LCD_CTRL_PORT, LCD_CTRL_E); // set "E" line
00192                 write_data((read_data()&0x0F) | (data<<4) );    // output data, low 4 bits
00193                 LCD_DELAY;                                                              // wait
00194                 LCD_DELAY;                                                              // wait
00195                 cbi(LCD_CTRL_PORT, LCD_CTRL_E); // clear "E" line
00196         #else
00197                 // 8 bit write
00198                 sbi(LCD_CTRL_PORT, LCD_CTRL_E); // set "E" line
00199                 outb(LCD_DATA_DDR, 0xFF);                               // set data I/O lines to output (8bit)
00200                 
00201                 write_data(data);
00202                 
00203                 LCD_DELAY;                                                              // wait
00204                 LCD_DELAY;                                                              // wait
00205                 cbi(LCD_CTRL_PORT, LCD_CTRL_E); // clear "E" line
00206         #endif
00207         //      leave data lines in input mode so they can be most easily used for other purposes
00208         #ifdef LCD_DATA_4BIT
00209                 outb(LCD_DATA_DDR, inb(LCD_DATA_DDR)&0x0F);             // set data I/O lines to input (4bit)
00210                 write_data(read_data() |0xF0);  // set pull-ups to on (4bit)
00211         #else
00212                 outb(LCD_DATA_DDR, 0x00);                       // set data I/O lines to input (8bit)
00213                 write_data(0xFF);                       // set pull-ups to on (8bit)
00214         #endif
00215 #else
00216         // memory bus write
00217         //sbi(MCUCR, SRW);                      // enable RAM waitstate
00218         lcdBusyWait();                          // wait until LCD not busy
00219         *((volatile unsigned char *) (LCD_CTRL_ADDR)) = data;
00220         //cbi(MCUCR, SRW);                      // disable RAM waitstate
00221 #endif
00222 }
00223 
00224 u08 lcdControlRead(void)
00225 {
00226 // read the control byte from the display controller
00227         register u08 data;
00228 #ifdef LCD_PORT_INTERFACE
00229         lcdBusyWait();                          // wait until LCD not busy
00230         #ifdef LCD_DATA_4BIT
00231                 outb(LCD_DATA_DDR, inb(LCD_DATA_DDR)&0x0F);             // set data I/O lines to input (4bit)
00232                 write_data(read_data() |0xF0);  // set pull-ups to on (4bit)
00233         #else
00234                 outb(LCD_DATA_DDR, 0x00);                       // set data I/O lines to input (8bit)
00235                 write_data(0xFF);                       // set pull-ups to on (8bit)
00236         #endif
00237         cbi(LCD_CTRL_PORT, LCD_CTRL_RS);                // set RS to "control"
00238         sbi(LCD_CTRL_PORT, LCD_CTRL_RW);                // set R/W to "read"
00239         #ifdef LCD_DATA_4BIT
00240                 // 4 bit read
00241                 sbi(LCD_CTRL_PORT, LCD_CTRL_E); // set "E" line
00242                 LCD_DELAY;                                              // wait
00243                 LCD_DELAY;                                              // wait
00244                 data = read_data()&0xF0;        // input data, high 4 bits
00245                 cbi(LCD_CTRL_PORT, LCD_CTRL_E); // clear "E" line
00246                 LCD_DELAY;                                              // wait
00247                 LCD_DELAY;                                              // wait
00248                 sbi(LCD_CTRL_PORT, LCD_CTRL_E); // set "E" line
00249                 LCD_DELAY;                                              // wait
00250                 LCD_DELAY;                                              // wait
00251                 data |= read_data()>>4; // input data, low 4 bits
00252                 cbi(LCD_CTRL_PORT, LCD_CTRL_E); // clear "E" line
00253         #else
00254                 // 8 bit read
00255                 sbi(LCD_CTRL_PORT, LCD_CTRL_E); // set "E" line
00256                 LCD_DELAY;                                              // wait
00257                 LCD_DELAY;                                              // wait
00258                 data = read_data();             // input data, 8bits
00259                 cbi(LCD_CTRL_PORT, LCD_CTRL_E); // clear "E" line
00260         #endif
00261         //      leave data lines in input mode so they can be most easily used for other purposes
00262 #else
00263         //sbi(MCUCR, SRW);                      // enable RAM waitstate
00264         lcdBusyWait();                          // wait until LCD not busy
00265         data = *((volatile unsigned char *) (LCD_CTRL_ADDR));
00266         //cbi(MCUCR, SRW);                      // disable RAM waitstate
00267 #endif
00268         return data;
00269 }
00270 
00271 void lcdDataWrite(u08 data) 
00272 {
00273 // write a data byte to the display
00274 #ifdef LCD_PORT_INTERFACE
00275         lcdBusyWait();                                                  // wait until LCD not busy
00276         sbi(LCD_CTRL_PORT, LCD_CTRL_RS);                // set RS to "data"
00277         cbi(LCD_CTRL_PORT, LCD_CTRL_RW);                // set R/W to "write"
00278         #ifdef LCD_DATA_4BIT
00279                 // 4 bit write
00280                 sbi(LCD_CTRL_PORT, LCD_CTRL_E); // set "E" line
00281                 outb(LCD_DATA_DDR, inb(LCD_DATA_DDR)|0xF0);     // set data I/O lines to output (4bit)
00282                 write_data((read_data() &0x0F) | (data&0xF0) ); // output data, high 4 bits
00283                 LCD_DELAY;                                                              // wait
00284                 LCD_DELAY;                                                              // wait
00285                 cbi(LCD_CTRL_PORT, LCD_CTRL_E); // clear "E" line
00286                 LCD_DELAY;                                                              // wait
00287                 LCD_DELAY;                                                              // wait
00288                 sbi(LCD_CTRL_PORT, LCD_CTRL_E); // set "E" line
00289                 write_data((read_data() &0x0F) | (data<<4) );   // output data, low 4 bits
00290                 LCD_DELAY;                                                              // wait
00291                 LCD_DELAY;                                                              // wait
00292                 cbi(LCD_CTRL_PORT, LCD_CTRL_E); // clear "E" line
00293         #else
00294                 // 8 bit write
00295                 sbi(LCD_CTRL_PORT, LCD_CTRL_E); // set "E" line
00296                 outb(LCD_DATA_DDR, 0xFF);                       // set data I/O lines to output (8bit)
00297                 write_data(data);                       // output data, 8bits
00298                 LCD_DELAY;                                                              // wait
00299                 LCD_DELAY;                                                              // wait
00300                 cbi(LCD_CTRL_PORT, LCD_CTRL_E); // clear "E" line
00301         #endif
00302         //      leave data lines in input mode so they can be most easily used for other purposes
00303         #ifdef LCD_DATA_4BIT
00304                 outb(LCD_DATA_DDR, inb(LCD_DATA_DDR)&0x0F);             // set data I/O lines to input (4bit)
00305                 write_data(read_data() |0xF0);  // set pull-ups to on (4bit)
00306         #else
00307                 outb(LCD_DATA_DDR, 0x00);                       // set data I/O lines to input (8bit)
00308                 write_data(0xFF);                       // set pull-ups to on (8bit)
00309         #endif
00310 #else
00311         // memory bus write
00312         //sbi(MCUCR, SRW);                      // enable RAM waitstate
00313         lcdBusyWait();                          // wait until LCD not busy
00314         *((volatile unsigned char *) (LCD_DATA_ADDR)) = data;
00315         //cbi(MCUCR, SRW);                      // disable RAM waitstate
00316 #endif
00317 }
00318 
00319 u08 lcdDataRead(void)
00320 {
00321 // read a data byte from the display
00322         register u08 data;
00323 #ifdef LCD_PORT_INTERFACE
00324         lcdBusyWait();                          // wait until LCD not busy
00325         #ifdef LCD_DATA_4BIT
00326                 outb(LCD_DATA_DDR, inb(LCD_DATA_DDR)&0x0F);             // set data I/O lines to input (4bit)
00327                 write_data(read_data() |0xF0);  // set pull-ups to on (4bit)
00328         #else
00329                 outb(LCD_DATA_DDR, 0x00);                       // set data I/O lines to input (8bit)
00330                 write_data(0xFF);                       // set pull-ups to on (8bit)
00331         #endif
00332         sbi(LCD_CTRL_PORT, LCD_CTRL_RS);                // set RS to "data"
00333         sbi(LCD_CTRL_PORT, LCD_CTRL_RW);                // set R/W to "read"
00334         #ifdef LCD_DATA_4BIT
00335                 // 4 bit read
00336                 sbi(LCD_CTRL_PORT, LCD_CTRL_E); // set "E" line
00337                 LCD_DELAY;                                                              // wait
00338                 LCD_DELAY;                                                              // wait
00339                 data = read_data()&0xF0;        // input data, high 4 bits
00340                 cbi(LCD_CTRL_PORT, LCD_CTRL_E); // clear "E" line
00341                 LCD_DELAY;                                                              // wait
00342                 LCD_DELAY;                                                              // wait
00343                 sbi(LCD_CTRL_PORT, LCD_CTRL_E); // set "E" line
00344                 LCD_DELAY;                                                              // wait
00345                 LCD_DELAY;                                                              // wait
00346                 data |= read_data()>>4;                 // input data, low 4 bits
00347                 cbi(LCD_CTRL_PORT, LCD_CTRL_E); // clear "E" line
00348         #else
00349                 // 8 bit read
00350                 sbi(LCD_CTRL_PORT, LCD_CTRL_E); // set "E" line
00351                 LCD_DELAY;                                                              // wait
00352                 LCD_DELAY;                                                              // wait
00353                 data = read_data();                     // input data, 8bits
00354                 cbi(LCD_CTRL_PORT, LCD_CTRL_E); // clear "E" line
00355         #endif
00356         //      leave data lines in input mode so they can be most easily used for other purposes
00357 #else
00358         // memory bus read
00359         //sbi(MCUCR, SRW);                      // enable RAM waitstate
00360         lcdBusyWait();                          // wait until LCD not busy
00361         data = *((volatile unsigned char *) (LCD_DATA_ADDR));
00362         //cbi(MCUCR, SRW);                      // disable RAM waitstate
00363 #endif
00364         return data;
00365 }

00372 
00373 void lcdInit()
00374 {
00375         // initialize hardware
00376         lcdInitHW();
00377         // LCD function set
00378         lcdControlWrite(LCD_FUNCTION_DEFAULT);
00379         // clear LCD
00380         lcdControlWrite(1<<LCD_CLR);
00381         delay_ms(60);   // wait 60ms
00382         // set entry mode
00383         lcdControlWrite(1<<LCD_ENTRY_MODE | 1<<LCD_ENTRY_INC);
00384         // set display to on
00385         //lcdControlWrite(1<<LCD_ON_CTRL | 1<<LCD_ON_DISPLAY | 1<<LCD_ON_BLINK);
00386         lcdControlWrite(1<<LCD_ON_CTRL | 1<<LCD_ON_DISPLAY );
00387         // move cursor to home
00388         lcdControlWrite(1<<LCD_HOME);
00389         // set data address to 0
00390         lcdControlWrite(1<<LCD_DDRAM | 0x00);
00391 
00392         // load the first 8 custom characters
00393         lcdLoadCustomChar((u08*)LcdCustomChar,0,0);
00394         lcdLoadCustomChar((u08*)LcdCustomChar,1,1);
00395         lcdLoadCustomChar((u08*)LcdCustomChar,2,2);
00396         lcdLoadCustomChar((u08*)LcdCustomChar,3,3);
00397         lcdLoadCustomChar((u08*)LcdCustomChar,4,4);
00398         lcdLoadCustomChar((u08*)LcdCustomChar,5,5);
00399         lcdLoadCustomChar((u08*)LcdCustomChar,6,6);
00400         lcdLoadCustomChar((u08*)LcdCustomChar,7,7);
00401 }
00402 
00403 void lcdHome(void)
00404 {
00405         // move cursor to home
00406         lcdControlWrite(1<<LCD_HOME);
00407 }
00408 
00409 void lcdClear(void)
00410 {
00411         // clear LCD
00412         lcdControlWrite(1<<LCD_CLR);
00413 }
00414 
00415 void lcdGotoXY(u08 x, u08 y)
00416 {
00417         register u08 DDRAMAddr;
00418 
00419         // remap lines into proper order
00420         switch(y)
00421         {
00422         case 0: DDRAMAddr = LCD_LINE0_DDRAMADDR+x; break;
00423         case 1: DDRAMAddr = LCD_LINE1_DDRAMADDR+x; break;
00424         case 2: DDRAMAddr = LCD_LINE2_DDRAMADDR+x; break;
00425         case 3: DDRAMAddr = LCD_LINE3_DDRAMADDR+x; break;
00426         default: DDRAMAddr = LCD_LINE0_DDRAMADDR+x;
00427         }
00428 
00429         // set data address
00430         lcdControlWrite(1<<LCD_DDRAM | DDRAMAddr);
00431 }
00432 
00433 void lcdLoadCustomChar(u08* lcdCustomCharArray, u08 romCharNum, u08 lcdCharNum)
00434 {
00435         register u08 i;
00436         u08 saveDDRAMAddr;
00437 
00438         // backup the current cursor position
00439         saveDDRAMAddr = lcdControlRead() & 0x7F;
00440 
00441         // multiply the character index by 8
00442         lcdCharNum = (lcdCharNum<<3);   // each character occupies 8 bytes
00443         romCharNum = (romCharNum<<3);   // each character occupies 8 bytes
00444 
00445         // copy the 8 bytes into CG (character generator) RAM
00446         for(i=0; i<8; i++)
00447         {
00448                 // set CG RAM address
00449                 lcdControlWrite((1<<LCD_CGRAM) | (lcdCharNum+i));
00450                 // write character data
00451                 lcdDataWrite( pgm_read_byte(lcdCustomCharArray+romCharNum+i) );
00452         }
00453 
00454         // restore the previous cursor position
00455         lcdControlWrite(1<<LCD_DDRAM | saveDDRAMAddr);
00456 
00457 }
00458 
00459 void lcdPrintData(char* data, u08 nBytes)
00460 {
00461         register u08 i;
00462 
00463         // check to make sure we have a good pointer
00464         if (!data) return;
00465 
00466         // print data
00467         for(i=0; i<nBytes; i++)
00468         {
00469                 lcdDataWrite(data[i]);
00470         }
00471 }
00472 
00473 void lcdProgressBar(u16 progress, u16 maxprogress, u08 length)
00474 {
00475         u08 i;
00476         u32 pixelprogress;
00477         u08 c;
00478 
00479         // draw a progress bar displaying (progress / maxprogress)
00480         // starting from the current cursor position
00481         // with a total length of "length" characters
00482         // ***note, LCD chars 0-5 must be programmed as the bar characters
00483         // char 0 = empty ... char 5 = full
00484 
00485         // total pixel length of bargraph equals length*PROGRESSPIXELS_PER_CHAR;
00486         // pixel length of bar itself is
00487         pixelprogress = ((progress*(length*PROGRESSPIXELS_PER_CHAR))/maxprogress);
00488         
00489         // print exactly "length" characters
00490         for(i=0; i<length; i++)
00491         {
00492                 // check if this is a full block, or partial or empty
00493                 // (u16) cast is needed to avoid sign comparison warning
00494                 if( ((i*(u16)PROGRESSPIXELS_PER_CHAR)+5) > pixelprogress )
00495                 {
00496                         // this is a partial or empty block
00497                         if( ((i*(u16)PROGRESSPIXELS_PER_CHAR)) > pixelprogress )
00498                         {
00499                                 // this is an empty block
00500                                 // use space character?
00501                                 c = 0;
00502                         }
00503                         else
00504                         {
00505                                 // this is a partial block
00506                                 c = pixelprogress % PROGRESSPIXELS_PER_CHAR;
00507                         }
00508                 }
00509                 else
00510                 {
00511                         // this is a full block
00512                         c = 5;
00513                 }
00514                 
00515                 // write character to display
00516                 lcdDataWrite(c);
00517         }
00518 
00519 }
00520
